page.title: 12TRADE IN THE VILLAGE CENTRE
page.content: Mr Hoyes owns a shop in the centre of the village.His shop was once the lifeboat house in1571.His shop is now in three sections.A fancy goods section,a toys section,(in a new octagonal building)and a hardwear section.In the summer time he works a seven day week from 9am to 9pm.He has five staff in the summer.In the winter he works five and a half days a week.He only works him-self. The shop was one of three shops that suvived the 1953 flood.In a whole year 80% of his trade comes from the summer and only 20% comes from winter.The population has doubled in the last 20 years to 2209.With 20,000 tourists visiting annually.A new bus station is to be built next to the village green to take coaches and buses from all over the country.Mr Hoyes hopes that this will increase his trade.
